tags: i'd like to join the jonsa club now
summary: I’ve always thought that incest (very close, brother/sister, parent/child) in ASOIAF was a message saying, “it’s wrong” but who...
body:
I’ve always thought that incest (very close, brother/sister, parent/child) in ASOIAF was a message saying, “it’s wrong” but who really needs to emphasize this in a monolithically long book series? It’s like saying murder is wrong. We all know it — nothing profound in making it a theme for seven books.

Instead of a “moral”, perhaps it’s forshadowing the final and ultimate ship, the end game that ends on the Iron Throne, a couple who is in a way brother and sister, and yet, not really. The readers have been reading of true brother/sister incest, knowing it’s wrong and often results in horrible children, but at the same time have gotten a little acclimatized to it so that when the final royal couple ascend the throne — and while they are not brother and sister by blood, they were in a sense brother and sister while growing up — the audience is more prepared to accept it.

Yup, the Jonsa shippers have convinced me, and now I’m finding evidence too!

I’ve always thought that incest (very close, brother/sister, parent/child) in ASOIAF was a message saying, “it’s wrong” but who really needs to emphasize this in a monolithically long book series? It’s like saying murder is wrong. We all know it — nothing profound in making it a theme for seven books.

Instead of a “moral”, perhaps it’s forshadowing the final and ultimate ship, the end game that ends on the Iron Throne, a couple who is in a way brother and sister, and yet, not really. The readers have been reading of true brother/sister incest, knowing it’s wrong and often results in horrible children, but at the same time have gotten a little acclimatized to it so that when the final royal couple ascend the throne — and while they are not brother and sister by blood, they were in a sense brother and sister while growing up — the audience is more prepared to accept it.

Yup, the Jonsa shippers have convinced me, and now I’m finding evidence too!

summary: the asoiaf/got fandom is so fucking annoying about quotes. you see a gifset of a character with a different character’s quote...
body: the asoiaf/got fandom is so fucking annoying about quotes. you see a gifset of a character with a different character’s quote and you throw tantrums for what? how does for example making a stannis gifset with a jon snow quote detract from jon’s story? the books have already been published, what has been printed can’t be erased by a manip or moodboard. grow up please

summary: I agree that Jaime should and will most likely swear himself to Bran but why are people acting like Sansa stans are crazy for...
body: I agree that Jaime should and will most likely swear himself to Bran but why are people acting like Sansa stans are crazy for thinking it might be Sansa that he swears himself to????? “Sansa Stark is my last chance at honor” is literally a line that came out of Jaime’s mouth. People aren’t pulling that out of thin air lmao

summary: Many people view Sansa and the hound’s interaction during blackwater as traumatic for Sansa and she creates the unkiss as a...
question: Many people view Sansa and the hound’s interaction during blackwater as traumatic for Sansa and she creates the unkiss as a coping mechanism. How would you try to explain that it isn’t a coping mechanism to those people?
answer:
Sansa definitely used memories of the Hound protecting her and her empathizing with him as coping mechanisms for trauma long before the Blackwater incident, so it is a well-established pattern of hers and has nothing to do with trying to cope with the singular incident of the Hound scaring her.

  • (Ser Arys) did hit her in the end, but not hard as Ser Meryn or Ser Boros might have, and at least he had argued. The others obeyed without question … except for the Hound - ACOK, Sansa I
  • Ser Dontos had tried to help, and he was no longer a knight, no more than the Imp was, nor the Hound … the Hound hated knights … I hate them too, Sansa thought. They are no true knights, not one of them. ACOK, Sansa III
  • Nightmares of the day Princess Myrcella had sailed still troubled her sleep; dark suffocating dreams that woke her in the black of night, struggling for breath. They had hemmed her in and thrown filth at her and tried to pull her off her horse, and would have done worse if the Hound had not cut his way to her side.

and:

  • The Hound leapt at them, his sword a blur of steel that trailed a red mist as it swung. When they broke and ran before him he had laughed, his terrible burned face for a moment transformed. - ACOK, Sansa IV
  • she even sang for Tyrion the Imp and for the Hound. He is no true knight but he saved me all the same, she told the Mother. Save him if you can, and gentle the rage inside him. ACOK, Sansa V

The problem is certain Sansa fans who are unable to accept GRRM’s explanations and motivations for her interactions with Sandor Clegane want to throw this back onto Sansan shippers when what they need to do is examine the evidence. 

GRRM has expressly stated that Jean Cocteau’s Beauty and the Beast was the basis for the Blackwater scene and that the unreliable narrative of the Unkiss actually serves a purpose in Sansa’s story.

Le Cygne on this thread from worg explains it further:

It’s a sexual awakening story based on Beauty and the Beast. (Cocteau clip here and more Cocteau and Beauty and the Beast here.

The Blackwater scene was a symbolic marriage night. Everything was there, the tall strong man giving her his cloak and (thanks to Sansa) kissing her. That’s her thousand times dream.

It’s symbolic foreshadowing, a hint of what’s to come. And that night is called back to in her dreams and then she places Sandor in the marriage bed because of how he kissed her.

She caresses his face. She gets under his cloak and the bells ring in hills and hollows (classic FEMALE orgasm imagery). Then she puts his cloak in a cedar chest (a hope chest) with her summer silks.

Let’s reach for that SIMPLE explanation first, since we have a ton of evidence to support it. GRRM is constantly teasing SanSan. Someone asked about their future and he WINKED.

By the way GRRM put a picture of them riding off together on his website… it’s a romantic depiction of this night. He also requested a picture of this night just like the Cocteau picture for a calendar.

(And he has that picture prominently placed in his office, by the way.)

So the issue these Sansa stans have is with GRRM, not shippers, and people willfully ignoring the direction of the author in favor of ship bashing because they refuse to accept reality.

blog.name: mayberobbsa
blog.title: it's more complicated than that!
blog.description: 22 | nonbinary | robbsa sideblog | pro jonsa | i sometimes make shitty moodboards | made icon myself | in desperate need of more robbsa

body:
you’re the one, the one that i’ve been looking for | robbsa au

prince robb loves the escape sailing provides. it’s only a bonus he gets more time with his childhood friend theon on their escapades on his ships.
one night, the seas are stormy just like robb’s mind and he’s swept off by the waves in his moment of torment.
grey wind, theon, and the rest of his crew spend the whole night and the next day looking for the drowned prince.
on the third day when they begrudgingly return to land for a bit rest before they launch out in search of robb again, they come to find the prince already home- healthy despite the pale pallor to his skin. he had been found washed up on the shores that morning and spoke of a beautiful red haired woman with the loveliest songs and bluest eyes who rescued him.

reblog.comment:

summary: a very quick little piece based on this artwork i just saw i couldnt pass it up without writing it, its too precious! thank you...
body:
a very quick little piece based on this artwork i just saw

i couldnt pass it up without writing it, its too precious!

thank you to @sizzlinbaconpeach for posting such a lovely piece!

She had been looking for him for close to an hour now, checking all of his usual hiding spots- his chambers and the crypts, under the Heart Tree and even the highest of towers. The garden had been more like a last resort for she’d truly not expected to find him there. But there he was all the same. There in the gardens where the winter roses still yet bloomed, clearly still cared for by someone in Winterfell. And now that she found him there, just how obvious it was. Of course Jon was there, surrounded by the beautiful blooms. They were his mother’s favorite flower, Sansa recalled her father saying Lyanna had always been enchanted by their lovely smell. Of course Jon would be there, if only to feel close to her.

He was alone on the bench with the lightest dusting of snow layered over his shoulders. Just how long had he been there? Sansa approached him quietly, noticing how his shoulders shook, telling her just how badly he was hurting. Not that she could blame him. How was one supposed to feel when you lived your whole life thinking you were someone, only to be told you were someone else? Sansa knew how badly Jon had always wanted to be called a Stark, to be a true born son of their father’s… And now he wasn’t even a bastard. In truth, he was far more than any single one of them. He was a prince, he was royalty. No… He was a King. But, Sansa couldn’t help but to still think of him as just Jon. He had always been a Stark to her, after all. This reveal of his parentage didn’t have to change anything if he didn’t want it to.

Reaching out, she placed her hand upon his shoulder and at once he turned to face her, his face somber and pale. He stared up at her for several long moments before his face crumpled, his own hand sliding into place over hers. She came around then, sinking onto the bench beside him, taking him into her arms as he began to cry. There were no words needed as he held fast to her, as if she were the only thing keeping him anchored to this world. Her body, warm and soft, revived his own cold, aching frame, reminding him that things were not yet all lost. For a long time they sat there together, arms around each other, until finally Jon’s tears began to fade and he sat up, though close to her side did he remain. Sansa slipped an arm around his shoulder, drawing him closer, and she felt Jon tip his head to rest against her own.

It was only then that she spoke.

“Nothing has to change you know?” Jon did not reply, but she felt him shift, his hand reaching out to take hold of hers where it sat on his knee. “No matter who anyone else says you are… No matter what kingdom you’re born to rule or not rule… You’re always going to be Jon Snow to me.” She turned her head then, catching the faintest of smiles on his lips before he sat up straight, though their shoulders still brushed.

A moment later, Jon rose up to his feet and Sansa watched as he reached for a winter rose, plucking it from its place in its bush. “For you.” He said as he offered it out for her to take, his lips curving with the first true smile she’d seen since his return to Winterfell. “Thank you, Sansa…” He spoke softly this time, his eyes holding so much more meaning than his words could ever say. She smiled as she took the rose from him, their gloved fingers brushing as she accepted the bloom.  

And then Jon turned, walking away from her there on the bench, leaving her with a racing heart and blushing cheeks.

i couldnt pass it up without writing it, its too precious!

thank you to @sizzlinbaconpeach for posting such a lovely piece!

blog.name: greedisgreen

blog.description: An Ever-Growing Rotation of My Obsessions

summary: A Prescription for Pain Chapter 18: Just Breathe
title: A Prescription for Pain Chapter 18: Just Breathe
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description: An eerie discomfort settled over Sansa as she unlocked the brand new front door with its brand new locks. It had only been a week since last she’d been to this house, but so much had changed since then. Not only in the physical appearance of the house (for she could see that Petyr’s man had done far more than just replace a broken door and lock), but the building itself felt foreign. Or she felt foreign in it.

Or she felt foreign in it.

blog.name: allons-ymrholmes
blog.description: 29 yr old Slytherin witch, who spends her free time traveling with 10, solving crimes with Sherlock, pledging her sword to Sansa Stark, brainstorming with Harrison Wells, walking in the moonlight with Thranduil, cooking with Hannibal, and hunting with the Winchesters.

summary: I started shipping Sansa and Tyrion from the moment he saved her in the throne room and the, “Lady Stark, you may survive us...
body:
I started shipping Sansa and Tyrion from the moment he saved her in the throne room and the, “Lady Stark, you may survive us yet.” His kindness to her and the look of respect on his face as she held her head high and repeated the lie necessary to save her head.

I never expected them to get together, like ever, but I still saw the potential. The more they interacted the more I saw it. THEN they are forced to marry and I was a goner as soon as he swore he wouldn’t touch her unless she wanted it.

Still, I knew it was unlikely they would ever truly be together. Sansa ran after the purple wedding… and defended Tyrion, time and again. And he defended her. Tyrion, the biggest whore lover who ever lived, went to a brothel and turned a woman down because of his wife. The wife who never laid with him.

Sansa defended Tyrion to Jon. 

“He’s not like other Lannisters. Tyrion was always kind to me.”

Tyrion praises Sansa’s intelligent.

“She’s smarter than she lets on.”

And now the reunion of these two is coming. This small, random, ship that I never had real hope for could very well end up as end-game and I am LIVING. 

Can it please be April 14th now??

summary: Walking in my sleep Like the naked trees Will they wake up again? Do they sleep, do they dream? Feel it as the wind strokes my...
album: All My Demons Greeting Me As A Friend (Deluxe Version)
caption:
Walking in my sleep
Like the naked trees
Will they wake up again?
Do they sleep, do they dream?

Feel it as the wind strokes my skin
I am moved by the chill
Hear the winter bird sing

aka Sansa Stark praying at Winterfell when she finally goes back home and is safe because fuck u D&D
